intro: Xanthophyllum papuanum, commonly known as the Papuan goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to New Guinea. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its yellow flowers and woody stems, which are typical of the genus Xanthophyllum. It grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forested areas. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
